intro: Heliophila gariepina, commonly known as the Gariep heliophila, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Heliophila gariepina is adapted to full sun exposure and is drought-tolerant, making it suitable for xeriscaping in arid environments.
